summary.seg: The manuscript contains the Synopsis Basilicorum maior, an alphabetically arranged selection of the imperial laws, with the so-called Appendix A, a series of Novellae that often accompany this work.

It was copied by the Greek scribe Nikolaos Tourrianos (1535/40-1608/10) in 1564 in Salamanca. Born in Crete, Tourrianos was active in various cities, such as Padua, Venice, Constantinople, Salamanca and Paris. He was scriptor of the University of Salamanca (1569-1573) and of the Library of El Escorial (from 1573).

The exemplar of this codex, the first copied by Tourrianos in Spain (see de Andres 1969, p. 26), is MS El Escorial, Real Biblioteca, R.II.11 (see Easterling 1961, p. 259; Burgmann-Fögen-Schminck-Simon 1995, p. 59), owned by the Spanish humanist and diplomat Diego Hurtado de Mendoza: it was copied following a request by the jurist Eduardo Caldera.

The Synopsis of the Basilics was really popular among Spanish jurists of the 16th century; after Diego Hurtado de Mendoza took one of his copies of the work to the Council of Trent, many copies of it were made. Nikolaos Tourrianos copied this work two more times, in MSS Salamanca, Biblioteca Universitaria, 2737 (Segovia, 1565), and El Escorial, Real Biblioteca, Σ.I.8 (Segovia 1565).

msItem.title: General index to the Synopsis Basilicorum maior
msItem.rubric: f. 2r Ὁ πίναξ τῶν νομίμων κατὰ στοιχεῖον
msItem.incipit: f. 2r Περὶ ἀγγαρειῶν καὶ παραγγαρειῶν
msItem.explicit: f. 12r Αἱ νεαραὶ τοῦ κυροῦ Ῥωμανοῦ, καὶ τοῦ κυροῦ Κωνσταντίνου καὶ τοῦ υἱοῦ αὐτοῦ· καὶ τοῦ κυροῦ Νικηφόρου τῶν βασιλέων
msItem.note: At the end there are three glosses, about λίβελλος, βρέβια, τίτλος.

msItem.title: Synopsis Basilicorum maior
msItem.rubric: f. 12v Ἐκλογὴ καὶ σύνοψις τῶν βασιλικῶν ξ΄ βιβλίων σὺν παραπομπαῖς κατὰ στοιχεῖον τοῦ περὶ πίστεως μόνου τίτλου προτεθέντος πάντων τῶν στοιχείων διὰ τὸ τίμιον
msItem.incipit: f. 12v Περὶ τῆς ὀρθοδόξου πίστεως τῶν χριστιανῶν
msItem.explicit: f. 246r μηκέτι μετερχέσθω διὰ τοῦ αὐτοῦ ἐπιτηδεύματος.
msItem.finalRubric: f.246r Τέλος σὺν θεῷ τῶν βασιλικῶν ξ΄ βιβλίων κατὰ στοιχεῖον.
msItem.note: The start of each book (στοιχεῖα) is indicated by the main scribe in the upper or side margins. Each paragraph is numbered in Greek numerals.

The text is accompanied by scholia: first scholion (f. 15r), inc. Ἐν τῷ β΄ κεφαλαίῳ τοῦ β΄ τίτλου (C.E. Zachariae von Lingenthal [ed.], Synopsis Basilicorum, in J. Zepos, P. Zepos, Jus Graecoromanum, vol. 5, Athens 1931, p. 30 b), last scholion (f. 244v), inc. Τὸ ψιλὸν σύμφωνον ἐξαχῶς (Zachariae von Lingenthal 1931, pp. 596-597 a)
On the Appendix, see Svoronos 1964, pp. 7-87

msItem.author: Romanus I Lecapenus, Emperor of the East, d. 948
msItem.title: Novellae
msItem.rubric: f. 246r Αἱ νεαραὶ τοῦ κυροῦ Ῥωμανοῦ τοῦ βασιλέως
msItem.incipit: f. 246r Ἀνθρώποις ἐστὶ ζηλωτὸν καὶ περισπούδαστον
msItem.explicit: f. 249v εἰς κοινὴν λυσιτέλειαν καὶ ὠφέλειαν.
msItem.note: I. Zepos, P. Zepos (eds.), Jus Graecoromanum, 1, Athens 1931, Coll. 3 nr. 5; F. Dölger (ed.), Regesten der Kaiserurkunden des oströmischen Reiches von 565-1453, 1, München-Berlin 1924, nr. 628
The Novella is preceded, as in all the tradition (see Zepos 1931, p. 206), by an epigram, Στίχοι ἰαμβικοί, inc. Νέον νόμον τίθεσι Ῥωμανὸς ἄναξ

msItem.author: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus, Emperor of the East, 905-959
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 6; Dölger 1924, nr. 656
msItem.rubric: f. 249v Αἱ νεαραὶ τοῦ κυροῦ Κωνσταντίνου τοῦ βασιλέως
msItem.incipit: f. 249v Παρὰ πολλῶν ἀνέμαθεν ἡ ἐκ θεοῦ βασιλεία
msItem.explicit: f. 250v καὶ ἐξετάζειν καὶ διοικεῖν περὶ τῶν πτωκῶν καὶ δυνατῶν.

msItem.author: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus, Emperor of the East, 905-959
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 8; Dölger 1924, nr. 673
msItem.rubric: f. 250v Περὶ στρατιωτῶν
msItem.incipit: f. 250v Ὥσπερ ἐν σώματι κεφαλή
msItem.explicit: f. 253r ἢ ἄρχοντος ἐπιτραπῆναι κεχρῆσθαι αὐτῷ.

msItem.author: Romanus II, Emperor of the East, 959-963
msItem.title: Edictum de fundis militaribus
msItem.note: Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 16; Dölger 1924, nr. 690
msItem.rubric: f. 253r Ἐκ τοῦ ἐκφωνηθέντος βασιλικοῦ ἐδίκτου πρὸς τοὺς ἐν τῷ θέματι τῶν Θρακησίων· μηνὶ μαρτίῳ ἰνδικτιῶνος ε΄ ἔτους ˏϛυο΄
msItem.incipit: f. 253r Ἐάν τινες μερίδας τινὰς ἀπὸ στρατιωτικῶν κατέχουσι τόπων
msItem.explicit: f. 253v τοῖς στρατεύμασιν ἡμῶν ἐπενεχθήσεται.

msItem.author: Nicephorus II Phocas, Emperor of the East, 912-969
msItem.title: Novella de monasteriis
msItem.note: Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 19; Dölger 1924, nr. 699
msItem.rubric: f. 254r Τοῦ κυροῦ Νικηφόρου τοῦ βασιλέως ἡ νέα νομοθεσία
msItem.incipit: f. 254r Ὁ τοῦ θεοῦ πατρὸς λόγος
msItem.explicit: f. 255v καὶ τῷ κοινῷ παντὶ φθέγξασθαι.

msItem.author: Romanus I Lecapenus, Emperor of the East, d. 948
msItem.title: Novellae
msItem.note: Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 2; Dölger 1924, nr. 595
msItem.rubric: f. 255v Νεαρὰ τοῦ κυροῦ Ῥωμανοῦ τοῦ γέροντος· περὶ ἐκποιήσεως κτημάτων· καὶ προτιμήσεως συγγενῶν καὶ κοινωνῶν καὶ ἀναμεμιγμένων·καὶ συμπαραχειμένων ὁλοτελῶς καὶ συναπτῶς ἡνωμένων· καὶ τῶν νοουμένων ὁμοτελῶν χωρίων καὶ ἀγριδίων· καὶ κωλύσεως δυνατῶν προσώπων· καὶ ἐκποιήσεως στρατιωτικῶν κτημάτων
msItem.incipit: f. 255v Παλαιὸς νόμος ἐστὶν ἵνα μηδεὶς παρὰ συγγενῶν
msItem.explicit: f. 257r κατὰ τοσοῦτον ἡ ἐκποίησις ἀναιρεῖται.

msItem.title: De rescindenda venditione
msItem.note: J. Leunclavius, Iuris Graeco-Romani tam canonici quam civilis tomi duo, Francoforti 1596, 2, pp. 165-166
msItem.rubric: f. 257r Περὶ τῶν κινούντων τὸν εἰς τὸ διπλοῦν ὑπερθεματισμόν
msItem.incipit: f. 257r Εἰ μὲν εὑρίσκονται οἱ ἐγκαλέσαντες μετὰ τὴν πρᾶσιν
msItem.explicit: f. 257v ἀποδίδοται τοῖς πωλήσασιν.

msItem.author: Cosma Magister, d. after 946
msItem.title: Sententia de paroecis
msItem.note: Leunclavius 1596, 2, p. 166
msItem.rubric: f. 257v Τοῦ μαγίστρου Κοσμᾶ ψῆφος περὶ παροίκων
msItem.incipit: f. 257v Καὶ εἰ μὲν ἐμφυτευτικῶς ἐξεδόθη ὁ τόπος
msItem.explicit: f. 257v εἰ μὴ διὰ τοῦ τοσούτου χρόνου ἀνεπιφωνήτου παραδρομῆς.
msItem.note: The text is directly attached to the preceding one, without interruption
Author and title are given by the scribe in a marginal annotation at f. 257v

msItem.author: Cosma Magister, d. after 946
msItem.title: Sententia
msItem.note: Leunclavius 1596, 2, p. 167
msItem.rubric: f. 257v Τοῦ αὐτοῦ ψῆφος
msItem.incipit: f. 257v Ζητήσεις καὶ περὶ τούτου
msItem.explicit: f. 258r ἀλλὰ καὶ κατὰ σύγκρισιν ποιότητος διανεμομένης.

msItem.note: G. E. Heimbach, Basilicorum libri LX, 6, Lipsiae 1870, p. 2 n. 8
msItem.incipit: f. 258r Τῶν πραττομένων ν΄ βιβλίων τῶν διγέστων οὕτως
msItem.explicit: f. 258r τὰ προγραφέντα μονόβιβλα ὁμοῦ βιβλία ν΄.

msItem.note: E. Schilbach, Byzantinische metrologische Quellen, Thessaloniki 1982, II 13 (right)
msItem.incipit: f. 258r Χρὴ γινώσκειν, ὅτι ὁ κάλαμος μεθ' οὗ μετροῦσιν τὴν σκαφεῖσαν γῆν
msItem.explicit: f. 258r καθὼς δὲ ἡ σπορίμη.

msItem.author: Athanasios, ho Scholastikos, active 6th century
msItem.title: Novellae Constitutiones, tit. 23
msItem.rubric: f. 258v Περὶ διαφθορᾶς ἀναγνωσμάτων
msItem.incipit: f. 258v Μηδεὶς ἀποκρισιάριος ἐναγέσθω ὑπὲρ τοῦ στείλαντος αὐτόν
msItem.explicit: f. 260r τοῖς πατράσιν ὑπόκεινται τῶν πόλεων.

msItem.author: Romanus I Lecapenus, Emperor of the East, d. 948
msItem.title: Novellae
msItem.note: Leunclavius 1596, 2, pp. 155-158
msItem.rubric: f. 260r Νεαρὰ Ῥωμανοῦ εἴργουσα τοὺς δυνατοὺς ἐξωνήσεις εἰς χωρίου ὁμάδα ποιεῖν
msItem.incipit: f. 260r Θεσπίζομεν ἐν πάσῃ πόλει καὶ χώρᾳ
msItem.explicit: f. 261r ὑπὲρ τῆς τῶν ὑπηκόων σωτηρίας.
msItem.note: It is an Epitome of chapters 1-8 of the Novella Zepos 1931, Coll. 3 Nov. 5 (see Svoronos 1964, p. 29)

msItem.author: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus, Emperor of the East, 905-959
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: Epitome of chapters 1-3 of the Novella Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 2 (see Svoronos 1964, p. 30)
msItem.rubric: f. 261r Νεαρὰ α΄ Κωνσταντίνου τοῦ βασιλέως· περὶ προτιμήσεως
msItem.incipit: f. 261r Παλαιὸς νόμος ἐστὶ μηδένα κωλύεσθαι
msItem.explicit: f. 262r καὶ τὴν ἀποτίμησιν αὐτοῦ τῷ δημοσίῳ εἰσπραχθήσεται.

msItem.author: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus, Emperor of the East, 905-959
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: Epitome of chapters 1-3 of the Novella Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 6 (see Svoronos 1964, p. 31)
msItem.rubric: f. 262r Νεαρὰ β΄ Κωνσταντίνου, περὶ τῶν δυνατῶν τῶν εἰσελθόντων εἰς κτῆσιν πενήτων
msItem.incipit: f. 262r Θεσπίζομεν ὅσοι ἀπὸ τῆς ἡμετέρας ἀναρρήσεως
msItem.explicit: f. 263r εἰς μῆνα μάρτιον ἰνδικτιῶνος ε΄.

msItem.author: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus, Emperor of the East, 905-959
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: Epitome of the Novella Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 8 (see Svoronos 1964, p. 31)
msItem.rubric: f. 263r Νεαρὰ γ΄ Κωνσταντίνου, περὶ στρατιωτῶν
msItem.incipit: f. 263r Θεσπίζομεν τοίνυν ὅπερ ἡ συνήθεια
msItem.explicit: f. 264r ἄρχοντος ἐπιτραπῆναι κεχρῆσθαι αὐτῷ.

msItem.author: Romanus II, Emperor of the East, 959-963
msItem.title: Rescriptum de restitutione pretii praediorum a potentibus evictorum
msItem.note: Epitome of the Novella Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 15 (see Svoronos 1964, p. 32)
msItem.rubric: f. 264r Νεαρὰ δ΄ Κωνσταντίνου, περὶ ἀναδόσεως στρατιωτῶν
msItem.incipit: f. 264r Θεσπίζομεν εἰ καὶ ὥρισται διὰ τῆς προτέρας νομοθεσίας
msItem.explicit: f. 264v ἀναργύρως ἀποκαθίστασθαι εἰς τοὺς ἰδίους τόπους.

msItem.author: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus, Emperor of the East, 905-959
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 13; Dölger 1924, nr. 679-681
msItem.rubric: f. 264v Νεαρὰ Κωνσταντίνου ε΄, ἡ ἀποκειμένη ἐν τῇ σακέλλῃ, περὶ φυγῶν ψυχαρίων καὶ ἀποπωλότων κτηνῶν
msItem.incipit: f. 264v Ὑπὲρ ἀπολωλότος ψυχαρίου
msItem.explicit: f. 265r τὸ δὲ περιττεῦον τῷ δημοσίῳ εἰσκομίζεσθαι.

msItem.author: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus, Emperor of the East, 905-959
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: It is an Epitome of chapters 5, 4, 1 of the Novella Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 7 (see Svoronos 1964, p. 33 and Burgmann-Fögen-Schminck-Simon 1995, p. 59)
msItem.rubric: f. 265r Νεαρὰ Κωνσταντίνου· περὶ τοῦ προσεδρεύειν ἐν τῷ δικαστηρίῳ τοὺς κινοῦντας ἀγωγήν· καὶ περὶ τῶν ἀπολιμπανομένων ἐπὶ τρισὶ μησὶν ἢ χρόνου
msItem.incipit: f. 265r Ἢ ἄλλως τὸ ἐναγόμενον εἰς δικαστήριον
msItem.explicit: f. 265r δικαίου ψήφῳ τὴν δίκην εὐλυτοῦσθαι.

msItem.author: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus, Emperor of the East, 905-959
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 7, par. δ΄ (4); Dölger 1924, nr. 674
msItem.rubric: f. 265r Νεαρὰ ζ΄ Κωνσταντίνου, περὶ τοῦ μηδὲν τοὺς πολιτικοὺς δικαστὰς λαμβάνειν
msItem.incipit: f. 265r Θεσπίζομεν μηδένα τῶν πολιτικῶν δικαστῶν
msItem.explicit: f. 265r καὶ παντὸς χρυσίου ὑπερφρονεῖν.

msItem.author: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus, Emperor of the East, 905-959
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 7, par. α΄ (1); Dölger 1924, nr. 674
msItem.rubric: f. 265r Περὶ στρατιωτικῶν
msItem.incipit: f. 265r Κελεύομεν τοὺς θεματικοὺς κριτάς
msItem.explicit: f. 265v καὶ ἕως δυοῖν νομισμάτων ἀναβιβάζεσθαι τὸ νόμισμα μίσθωμα.

msItem.author: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus, Emperor of the East, 905-959
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: It is an Epitome of the Novella Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 9 (see Svoronos 1964, p. 35)
msItem.rubric: f. 265v Νεαρὰ η΄ Κωνσταντίνου, περὶ συνηθειῶν
msItem.incipit: f. 265v Κελεύομεν μὴ πορίζεσθαί τι κέρδος
msItem.explicit: f. 266v εἰ πολλάκις ποσότητος εἶεν τὸ ἀποδιδόμενον.

msItem.author: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus, Emperor of the East, 905-959
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 7, par. β΄ (2); Dölger 1924, nr. 674
msItem.rubric: f. 266v Νεαρὰ θ΄ Κωνσταντίνου· περὶ ἀνοίξεως διαθηκῶν
msItem.incipit: f. 266v Ἐπειδὴ αἱ διαθῆκαι παρὰ τῷ κοιαίστωρι ἀνοίγονται
msItem.explicit: f. 266v τὸ τριπλοῦν ἀποδώσει.

msItem.author: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus, Emperor of the East, 905-959
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 7, par. γ΄ (3); Dölger 1924, nr. 674
msItem.rubric: f. 266v Νεαρὰ ι΄ Κωνσταντίνου, περὶ τῶν συνηθειῶν τοῦ σκρίβα
msItem.incipit: f. 266v Ἐπειδὴ δὲ ὁ σκρίβας οὐκ ἔστι τέλειος
msItem.explicit: f. 266v πορίζεσθαι τὸν μισθόν.

msItem.author: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus, Emperor of the East, 905-959
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: It is an Epitome of the Novella Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 10 (see Burgmann-Fögen-Schminck-Simon 1995, p. 59)
msItem.rubric: f. 266v Νεαρὰ ια΄ Κωνσταντίνου, περὶ τῶν φονευόντων μετὰ ξίφος ἢ ξύλων μεγάλων ἢ λίθων ἐκ προνοίας
msItem.incipit: f. 266v Ἡ τοῦ Μωσέως νομοθεσία ἀποφαίνεται
msItem.explicit: f. 267r ἐν τῷ ξ΄ βιβλίῳ ἐφευρήσει.

msItem.author: Nicephorus II Phocas, Emperor of the East, 912-969
msItem.title: Novella de fundis militum Armenicorum et homicidiarium, epitome
msItem.note: It is an Epitome of the Novella Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 18 (see Svoronos 1964, p. 38)
msItem.rubric: f. 267v Νεαρὰ α΄ Νικηφόρου τοῦ βασιλέως· περὶ Ἁρμενικῶν τόπων
msItem.incipit: f. 267v Θεσπίζομεν ὅσοι τῶν Ἁρμενικῶν στρατιωτῶν
msItem.explicit: f. 267v ὑπηρετείτω τῇ στρατείᾳ.

msItem.author: Nicephorus II Phocas, Emperor of the East, 912-969
msItem.title: Novella de monasteriis, epitome
msItem.note: It is an Epitome of the Novella Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 19 (see Svoronos 1964, p. 39)
msItem.rubric: f. 267v Νεαρὰ β΄ Νικηφόρου τοῦ βασιλέως· περὶ μοναστηρίων, ξενώνων καὶ γηρωκομείων
msItem.incipit: f. 267v Θεσπίζομεν ὅσοι μοναστήρια ξενῶνας τὲ καὶ γηρωκομεῖα
msItem.explicit: f. 268r καὶ δι' ἐπαίνου μᾶλλον τὸ πρᾶγμα τίθεμεν.

msItem.author: Nicephorus II Phocas, Emperor of the East, 912-969
msItem.title: Novellae Constitutiones
msItem.note: Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 20, par. α΄ (1) (des. p. 254 l. 22); Dölger 1924, nr. 712
msItem.rubric: f. 268r Νεαρὰ γ΄ Νικηφόρου, περὶ τοῦ ἐξωνεῖσθαι δυνατοῖς ἀπὸ δυνατῶν
msItem.incipit: f. 268r Θεσπίζομεν τὴν παρὰ τῶν προβεβασιλευκότων
msItem.explicit: f. 268r πρὸς ἅπαντας τὴν νομοθεσίαν ποιούμενοι.

msItem.author: Nicephorus II Phocas, Emperor of the East, 912-969
msItem.title: Novella de monasteriis, epitome
msItem.note: Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 21; Dölger 1924, nr. 719
msItem.rubric: f. 268r Νεαρὰ δ΄ Νικηφόρου, περὶ οἰκημάτων
msItem.incipit: f. 268r Ἐπειδήπερ τινὲς τῶν κεκωλυμένων ἀπὸ τῶν νεαρῶν νομοθεσιῶν
msItem.explicit: f. 268v καὶ μὴ ἀποστερεῖσθαι τοὺς ἠγορακότας τῶν ἰδίων ἐμπονημάτων.

msItem.author: Nicephorus II Phocas, Emperor of the East, 912-969
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 20, par. β΄ (2), des. p. 254 l. 36; Dölger 1924, nr. 712
msItem.rubric: f. 268v Νεαρὰ ε΄ Νικηφόρου· βοηθοῦσα τοὺς ἐξωνησαμένους πρὸ τοῦ καιροῦ τῆς ἐνδείας
msItem.incipit: f. 268v Κελεύομεν ἐπεἰ ἡ τῶν μ΄ χρόνων παραδρομή
msItem.explicit: f. 268v καὶ τοῦ πλείονος ἐφιεμένους.

msItem.author: Leo VI, Emperor of the East, 866-912
msItem.title: Novellarum ecloga
msItem.rubric: f. 268v Ἐκλογὴ τῶν νεαρῶν Λέοντος τοῦ Εὐσεβοῦς βασιλέως
msItem.incipit: f. 268v Θεσπίζομεν ἀπὸ τοῦ νῦν καὶ εἰς τὸν ἅπαντα χρόνον
msItem.explicit: f. 278v ὑπέρτερον καὶ κατὰ νόμον οἰκονομεῖν ὃς ἄγει τοὺς ὑπηκόους.
msItem.note: The Novellae are numbered in the margins from α΄ (1) to νε΄ (55); there are actually 56 Novellae, the no. λη΄ (38) is repeated twice, at ff. 275r and 275v
About this text see P. Noailles-A. Dain, Les Novelles de Léon le Sage, Paris 1944, pp. XXXVII-XLVII

msItem.author: Basil II, Emperor of the East, approximately 958-1025
msItem.title: Novellae constitutiones
msItem.note: Zepos 1931, 1, Coll. 3 Nov. 29, par. α΄ (1)-ϛ΄ (6); Dölger 1924, nr. 783
msItem.rubric: f. 278v Νομοθεσία νεαρὰ Βασιλείου πορφυρογεννήτου δεσπότου ἐκφωνηθεῖσα κατὰ τὸν Ἰαννουάριον μῆνα τῆς θ΄ ἰνδικτιῶνος τοῦ ˏϛφδ΄ ἔτους
msItem.incipit: f. 278v Ἐπειδήπερ ἡ βασιλεία μου
msItem.explicit: f. 281r εἰ γὰρ ἀληθῆ ἦσαν προεκομίσθησαν ἂν παρὰ τῶν ἐχόντων αὐτά.

msItem.author: Sisinnius II Constantinopolitanus d. 998
msItem.title: Tomus de matrimonio
msItem.note: V. Grumel-J. Darrouzès, Les Regestes des Actes du Patriarcat de Constantinople, 1.2-3, Paris 1989, n. 804
msItem.rubric: f. 281v Σισίνιος ἐλέῳ Θεοῦ ἀρχιεπίσκοπος Κωνσταντινουπόλεως νέας Ῥώμης, εἰς τὴν ἐπ' ὀλέθρῳ τοῦ γάμου ἐπεισφρήσασαν ἤδη τῇ Χριστοῦ ποίμνῃ ἀθεμιτογαμίαν, εἴτ' οὖν αἱμομιξίαν· καὶ πυρὸς δίκην πυρπολοῦσαν τὰ σύμπαντα, ἥτις Θεοῦ χάριτι νῦν κανονικῶς καὶ νομίμως συνοδικῇ ἀποφάσει ἐκωλύθη, κατὰ τὴν εἰκάδα α΄ τοῦ Φευρουαρίου μηνὸς τῆς ἐνεστώσης ἰνδικτιῶνος ι΄, ἐν ἔτει τῷ ˏϛφε΄
msItem.incipit: f. 281v Καὶ ἰατρὸς ἡδίων ἐκεῖνος, καὶ πολλοῦ ἄξιος πόλεσιν
msItem.explicit: f. 284r Κωνσταντῖνος Κίου Ἰωάννης Δέρκου.

msItem.title: De actionibus
msItem.note: I. Zepos, P. Zepos (eds.), Jus Graecoromanum, 3, Athens 1931, 324-326
msItem.rubric: f. 284r Δεαστιανίβους· περὶ ἰδικῶν ἀγογῶν
msItem.incipit: f. 284r Ἐν τῷ διαπέμπεσθαι βιβλίον ἀνάγκη ὁρίζεσθαι τὴν ἀγωγήν
msItem.explicit: f. 288r καὶ τῷ παραγγέλματι τῶν ἀγορανόμων εἰς τὸ τετραπλοῦν.
msItem.note: After f. 286v l. 18 the space of 4 lines has been left blank by the scribe, were there is a lacuna common to the tradition of the text (see Zepos 1931, 3, p. 367 l. 16)
After f. 287v l. 6, were there is a lacuna common to the tradition of the text (see Zepos 1931, 3, p. 368 l. 41), the scribe inserted within the text a brief metrology treatise.

msItem.title: De metiendi modo
msItem.note: Schilbach 1982, II 10
msItem.rubric: f. 287v Μέτρον γεωμετρικόν
msItem.incipit: f. 287v Ἐχέτω ἡ ὀργυιὰ σπιθαμὰς θ΄
msItem.explicit: f. 287v καὶ γίνεται γῆ μοδίων σϙη΄
msItem.note: The text is inserted within De actionibus and is accompanied by a little diagram (see A. Dain, Métrologie byzantine. Calcul de la superficie des terres, in: Mémorial Louis Petit, Bucarest 1948, p. 61). After f. 287v l. 15, in the space of 7 lines, the scribe wrote a Greek alphabet with the corresponding letters of the Latin one.

msItem.author: Saint Gregory of Nazianzus
msItem.title: Testament
msItem.rubric: f. 288r Τὸ ἶσον τῆς διαθήκης τοῦ ἁγίου Γρηγορίου τοῦ θεολόγου
msItem.incipit: f. 288r Γρηγόριος ἐπίσκοπος τῆς καθολικῆς ἐκκλησίας
msItem.explicit: f. 289v Θεμίστιος ἐπίσκοπος τῆς καθολικῆς ἐκκλησίας τῆς κατὰ Ἀδριανοῦ πόλεως παρὼν καὶ τὰ ἐξῆς. Μετεγράφη ἐκ τοῦ ἀρχετύπου τοῦ συγκειμένου ἐν τῇ ἐκκλησίᾳ Ναζιανζοῦ.

msItem.title: Colophon
msItem.colophon: f. 289v Πόνος Νικολάου Τουρριανοῦ τοῦ Κρητὸς ἐν Σαλμαντικῆ, ˏαφξδ΄ οκτωβρίου, κ΄.

support.material: ff. [i]-[ii], [iii]-[iii] Western paper, folded in folio. Watermark: Leaf ( 43 25 ) in the centre of the folio without correspondence in the main repertoires.

ff. 2-289 Western paper, folded in folio. Watermark: Crescent in a circle surmounted by a cross with clovers at the edges, in the circle the letters MI . ( 75 44 ) in the centre of the folio identical with Sosower, Croissant 20 which is dated to 1565.

supportDesc.foliation: Modern pencil foliation in Arabic numerals, in the top right hand corner, recto: [i]-[ii] + 1-289 + [iii].

At ff. 12v-246r (Synopsis Basilicorum maior) the main scribe wrote running heads in black ink in the upper margin of the leaves, indicating the book of the work by its letter, see e.g. at f. 168v, where the μ chapter starts, Στοιχεῑον μ, and in the subsequent leaves, ff.169r-180r μ.

collation.p: The manuscript consists of a binion, 35 quaternions, a quinion and one endleaf. The first quire is a binion formed by ff. [i]-[ii], 1; it is unclear whether the first leaf of the quire is the left pastedown or is not present. In the second quire, the second leaf is not present, without affecting the text. The last leaf of quire 37 is not present without affecting the text.
collation.signatures: Greek quire signatures in the scribe's hand on the first folio recto and last verso of each quire, lower centre, original to the production of the manuscript: from α΄ (1, f. 2r) to λϛ΄(36, f. 281r). The last verso of the last quire (f. 289v) does not have a signature.

supportDesc.condition: The manuscript is in good condition. Humidity and water stains are found throughout the volume, see e.g. ff. 2r-19r in the upper part of the gutter, alongside the lower edge of the leaves on ff. 268r-278v, alongside the lower, the outer and partially the upper edge of the leaves on ff. 279r-289v. Some yellow stains on ff. 151v and 152v. There is a tear on the lower margin of f. 258r. The original f. 1r has been pasted on an endleaf.

layoutDesc.layout: ff. 2r-259r A single column of 32 lines. 245 130
ff. 259v-288v A single column of 34-35 lines. ca. 260-270 140

handNote.p: ff. 2r-289v Hand A: the text has been written by Torre, Nicolás de la, 1535/40-c.1610 Nikolaos Tourrianos (1535/40-c.1610) , (Νικόλαος Τουρριανός, RGK I, 319. See also RGK II, 438; RGK III, 520) in a minuscule script with "baroque" features; passim vertical strokes are significantly extended in the lower margin, with decorative scrollworks (see e.g. f. 265r).
The scribe in this manuscript differentiates the cited text from the commentary by using a larger script.
The text, including titles and initials, is written in grey/black ink.
The scribe wrote also additions to the text and scholia in the margins.

Hand B: a western European hand (16th/17th c.) added annotations in Latin and in Greek to the index (ff. 2r-12r; mostly they are Latin translations of the topics dealt with in the chapters) and passim annotations and corrections to the text (see e.g. ff. 40r, 54r, 54v). The writing, an informal minuscule, is regular in size, slightly slanting to the right.

Hand C: a later hand added passim annotations and corrections to the text in light brown ink, frequently introducing them by the abbreviated form of γράφε/γράφεται (see e.g. f. 173r) and by ἄρα (see e.g. f. 196v). The script is an informal minuscule, maybe by a western European hand, slanting to the right, irregular, traced with nervous movements.

decoDesc.decoNote: On ff. 2r and 12v there are two small pylai in black ink with a vegetal motif of vine scrolls.

Several friezes in black ink are present throughout the manuscipt. There are friezes with a vegetal motif of vine volute (see e.g. f. 3v), very simple linear friezes with vine leaves (see e.g. f. 4v), friezes with palmette motif (see e.g. f. 5v), friezes with clover motif (see e.g. ff. 8r, 11v, 185v, 281v).
Initials in ekthesis in black ink are decorated with a vegetal motif with scrollworks, and clover and vine motifs see e.g. ff. 12v, 48r, 53v.
Minor initials written in black ink see e.g. ff. 2r-12r.
Clovers and crosses in black ink are traced passim at the end of texts (see e.g. 12r, 258r, 281r.

additions.p: Hand B wrote an annotation on the manuscript's contents on f. 1v, Synopsis basilicorum.

On f. 246r, where the Synopsis Basilicorum ends, Tourrianos wrote in the right margin an annotation saying that the codex is a copy of a manuscript owned by Diego Hurtado de Mendoza, copied at the request of Eduardo Caldera.
On f. 1r there is a note of value in Latin and Spanish (see Provenance).
At f. 289v a later hand wrote under the colophon the date in Arabic numerals, 1564. Another hand wrote it with pencil.

binding.p: Western binding, parchment over couched-laminate boards. Rebacked, spine covered in leather, tooled in gold with title Ius civile graecorum M.S.; leather label on spine with a part of the shelfmark (5 11).

On the left board Thomas Tanner (1674-1737) wrote the number (and signature) which the codex has in his handwritten list of the manuscripts of John Moore. Therefore the binding, in any case, cannot be dated later than 1714.
On the upper part of the fore-edge is written the number 5, which probably corresponds with the number written in the upper margin of f. 2r, being maybe an ancient signature of the manuscript.
binding.condition: In fair condition, with some scratches and worm holes on the right board.

accMat.p:
Between the leaves there is a small piece of western paper, [173a].
102 100 .
It contains a text in modern Greek, written in black ink by a late hand (not before 17th c.), a message adressed by a certain Georgios to a certain Konstantinos.

origin.p: The manuscript was written by the Greek scribe Nikolaos Tourrianos in Salamanca in 1564.

It was copied from MS El Escorial, Real Biblioteca, R.II.11 (see Easterling 1961, p. 259; de Andres 1969, p. 26; Burgmann-Fögen-Schminck-Simon 1995, p. 59), owned by Diego Hurtado de Mendoza (1503-1575) Hurtado de Mendoza, Diego, 1503-1575 , following a request by the Portuguese humanist Eduardo Caldera (16th-17th c.) Caldeira, Duarte, 16th-17th century ; this is stated in a marginal note by Nikolaos Tourrianos on f. 246r, where the Synopsis Basilicorum ends: Τὸ ἶσον τῆς ἑξηκονταβίβλου τῆς τοῦ λαμπροτάτου Διέγου Μενδοκίου, τῷ τοῦ Δουάρδου Καλδέρου τοῦ νομικοῦ προστάγματι καταγραφομένης. (A later hand, Hand C, changed καταγραφομένης in μεταγραφομένης).

In the middle of the upper margin of f. 2r there is an annotation in Tourrianos' hand, maybe an older shelf-mark (see Easterling 1961, p. 258), n° 5; the number was corrected by another hand, and it is not clear what was written below.

provenance.p: Afterward, the manuscript was owned by a certain J.B. Hautin, probably to be identified with Jean Baptiste II Hautin, son of the French scholar and numismatist Jean-Baptiste Hautin (approximately b. 1580 d. 1640) Haultin, Jean-Baptiste, approximately 1580-1640 (or possibly with his nephew Jean Baptiste III; on the problem of the identification of Hautin see Jackson 2006, pp. 38-40). The name of Hautin appears twice in the manuscript: on the left pastedown, J. B. Hautin , where it is accompanied by the title of the principal work, Synopsis basilicon, and on the right pastedown, J. B. Hautin). Hautin wrote in his hand a title for the manuscript on f. [ii] verso, Synopsis basilicon (see Easterling 1961, p. 258).

The manuscript was later acquired by John Moore (1646-1714), bishop of Ely Moore, John, 1646-1714 : number 978 (c. 12) in the handwritten supplementary list of Moore's manuscripts, now MS CUL Oo.7.50(2), compiled by Thomas Tanner (1674-1735) after the publication of Bernard, Catalogi librorum manuscriptorum Angliæ et Hiberniæ (1697). On the left cover there is the annotation 978 | (c. 12), referring to the number of the manuscript in Tanner's list and to what looks like a shelfmark of unclear origin, also reported by Tanner (see Easterling 1961, p. 257 note 4).

history.acquisition: Presented to the University Library in 1715 by George I George I, King of Great Britain, 1660-1727 . On the left pastedown is glued the engraved bookplate made by John Pine for the Royal Library (1737).

recordHist.source: Description (2019) draws on A catalogue of the Manuscripts preserved in the Library of the University of Cambridge, vol. 3, Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, 1858, pp. 680-685, and P. E. Easterling, Two Greek MSS. of Spanish provenance in Bishop Moore's collection, in: Transactions of the Cambridge Bibliographical Society 3, 1961, pp. 257-262.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card. For information on eligibility and admissions procedures, see Joining the Library). For further information on the availability of the manuscript, please contact the Manuscripts Reading Room.
